{{Use mdy dates|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox YouTube personality | name = Grace Helbig | image = File:Grace Helbig.jpg | caption = | birth_name = Grace Anne Helbig | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1985|09|27}} | birth_place = [[Woodbury, New Jersey]], U.S. | education = [[Ramapo College]] <small>([[Bachelor of Arts|BA]])</small> | occupation = Comedian, YouTube personality, actress, producer, author | residence = [[Los Angeles, California]], U.S. | channel_name = graciehinabox | genre = [[Comedy]] | years_active = 2006–present | subscribers = 2.9 million | subscriber_date = August 2018 | views = 310 million | view_date = August 2018 | network = [[Studio71]] | associated_acts = {{flatlist| * [[Hannah Hart]] * [[Mamrie Hart]] }} | silver_button = yes | silver_year = 2014 | gold_button = yes | gold_year = 2014 | stats_update = August 20, 2018 }}
'''Grace Anne Helbig''' (born September 27, 1985) is an American television and [[YouTube personality]]. She is the creator and host of the [[YouTube]] channel ''it'sGrace'', the [[podcast]] ''Not Too Deep with Grace Helbig'', and co-host of the YouTube series ''This Might Get...''.
Helbig created and hosted the 2008–2013 [[My Damn Channel]] web series ''DailyGrace'', was a correspondent on the [[G4 (U.S. TV channel)|G4 network]] tech series ''[[Attack of the Show!]]'', played [[List of MyMusic characters#Idol|Idol]] on the [[Fine Brothers]]' web series ''[[MyMusic]]'', appeared in a series of [[Lowe's]] [[Television advertisement|television commercials]], co-produced and starred in the feature films ''[[Camp Takota]]'', ''[[Electra Woman and Dyna Girl (2016 film)|Electra Woman and Dyna Girl]]'' and ''[[Dirty 30 (film)|Dirty 30]]'', authored two comedic [[handbook]]s for [[Millennials]]: ''Grace's Guide: The Art of Pretending to Be a Grown-up'' and ''Grace & Style: The Art of Pretending You Have It'', and created and hosted the 2015 comedy/talk show on the [[E!]] television network ''[[The Grace Helbig Show]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/shows/the_grace_helbig_show/news/629519/grace-helbig-announces-new-show-title-and-premiere-date-in-hilarious-video-find-out-when-she-s-coming-to-e |title=GRACE HELBIG SHARES NEW SHOW TITLE & PREMIERE DATE IN HILARIOUS VIDEO! |date= |accessdate=March 15, 2015}}</ref>
==Early life== Helbig was born in [[Woodbury, New Jersey]], to John and Theresa. She has an older brother, John, and a younger brother, Tim. She attended [[Gateway Regional High School (New Jersey)|Gateway Regional High School]] in [[Woodbury Heights, New Jersey]].<ref>Roy, Melony. [http://philadelphia.cbslocal.com/2015/04/24/woodbury-heights-youtube-star-gets-her-own-cable-network-show/ "Woodbury Heights YouTube Star Gets Her Own Cable Network Show"], [[KYW-TV]], April 24, 2015. Accessed June 8, 2015. "A Woodbury Heights woman has gone from YouTube star to talk show host on a cable network... Grace Helbig is an actress, comedian, author, YouTube star and now the host of "The Grace Helbig Show" on E! but before all that she was a track star at Gateway Regional and once a semi finalist for the Miss NJ pageant."</ref> She was a successful [[Track and field|track]] star and medal-winning [[Pole vault|pole-vaulter]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/courierpostonline/doc/436986488.html?FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Jan%209,%202003&author=&pub=Courier%20Post&edition=&startpage=&desc=Versatile%20Helbig%20excels%20in%20classroom,%20on%20track%20and%20now%20with%20pole%20vault |title=Versatile Helbig excels in classroom, on track and now with pole vault |publisher=Pqasb.pqarchiver |work=[[Courier Post]] |last=Callahan |first=Kevin |date=January 9, 2003 |accessdate=September 10, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.prweb.com/releases/2008/3/prweb761294.htm |title=Dailymotion Features Exclusive Debut of My Damn Channel's Bedtime Stories |publisher=Prweb.com |date=March 11, 2008 |accessdate=September 10, 2013}}</ref>
In 2003, Helbig began studying at [[Ramapo College]] in [[Mahwah, New Jersey]] and graduated ''[[summa cum laude]]'' with a [[Bachelor of Arts]] in Digital Filmmaking from Ramapo's School of Contemporary Arts.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.northjersey.com/news/tv-star-grace-helbig-tells-ramapo-college-graduates-fear-can-be-their-guide-1.1335881|title=TV star Grace Helbig tells Ramapo College graduates fear can be their guide|author=MARINA VILLENEUVE|work=NorthJersey.com|accessdate=March 25, 2016}}</ref> It was there that she formed a sketch comedy group called Baked Goods with her best friend, Michelle Akin. She took [[improvisational theatre|improv]] classes at the [[Peoples Improv Theater]] in [[New York City]]. In 2005, she entered the [[Miss New Jersey USA]] pageant competition, reaching the semi-finals.<ref name="MissNewJersey" />
==YouTube and other Web video== [[File:Grace Helbig Vlogbrothers 2016.jpg|200x200px|thumb|Helbig appearing in a [[Vlogbrothers]] video in 2016]]
===Content creator=== In November 2007, Helbig [[house sitting|house-sat]] for a family in [[South Orange, New Jersey]]. To alleviate boredom and keep herself entertained, she began a daily [[vlog]] of her house sitting experience on her personal YouTube channel ''GracieHinABox''. Beginning March 2008, Helbig and her college roommate Michelle Akin (née Vargas) created the ''Grace n' Michelle'' YouTube channel. The most recent video on this channel was uploaded on October 25, 2013, when Helbig visited Akin in [[Brooklyn]].
In early 2008, Helbig narrated the short-lived animated web series, ''Bedtime Stories'' on [[My Damn Channel]], which consisted of R-rated parodies of classic fairy tales.<ref name="BedtimeStories" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://tv.sys-con.com/node/585266 |title=My Damn Channel Gives in to Irrational Fans |publisher=sys-con.com |date=June 9, 2008 |accessdate=September 10, 2013}}</ref> My Damn Channel founder and CEO Rob Barnett discovered her personal vlogs through her profile and offered her the opportunity to host her own video blog web series on the My Damn Channel website.<ref name="LAWeekly">{{cite web|last=Carrie |first=Stephanie |url=http://blogs.laweekly.com/arts/2013/07/grace_helbig_mymusic.php |title=Why Grace Helbig Could Be the Next Big Star to Come From YouTube |publisher=Blogs.laweekly.com |date=July 29, 2013 |accessdate=September 24, 2013}}</ref> This became ''DailyGrace'', which premiered on April 14, 2008, with new episodes published every weekday.<ref name="statedMagInterview" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20080714005842/en/Southern-Comfort-Big-Digital-Play-Bringing-SoCo |title=Southern Comfort Makes Big Digital Play Bringing the SoCo Music Experience to the Web |work=[[Business Wire]] |date=July 14, 2008 |accessdate=September 10, 2013}}</ref><ref name="CBSWiredForWomen" /> On October 11, 2010, ''DailyGrace'' was launched as its own [[YouTube]] channel. By the end of December 2013, the channel had amassed over 2.4 million subscribers and over 211 million video views on YouTube.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2013/12/31/my-damn-channel-daily-grace-helbig/ |title=Grace Helbig Is Leaving My Damn Channel And ‘Daily Grace’ In 2014 |date=December 31, 2013 |accessdate=May 13, 2014}}</ref> From the series' inception in April 2008 through December 2013, Helbig created over 830 ''DailyGrace'' episodes for the ''DailyGrace'' YouTube channel—in addition to the 690 ''DailyGrace'' episodes that had been published exclusively on the My Damn Channel website (i.e., all episodes up to October 8, 2010 as well as additional extra videos after that date).<ref name="DailygraceMDC"/>
From March 2012 through January 2013, Helbig hosted ''My Damn Channel LIVE'' once a week from the company's New York City studio (the remaining weekday episodes were hosted by Beth Hoyt). In November 2013, the series was revived in a weekly format as ''My Damn Channel LIVE: Hangout'', with Helbig making a few appearances via [[Videophone|video chat]] from the Los Angeles studio.
On September 13, 2013, Helbig premiered her weekly web series ''Grace's Faces'' on beauty guru [[Bobbi Brown]]'s newly created YouTube channel ''I love makeup.''<ref>{{cite web|last=Gutelle |first=Sam |url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2013/09/06/bobbi-brown-cosmetics-i-love-makeup-collective-digital-studio/ |title=Bobbi Brown, Collective DS Celebrate Cosmetics With 'I love makeup.' |publisher=Tubefilter.com |date=September 6, 2013 |accessdate=September 24, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Kenzie Bryant |url=http://racked.com/archives/2013/09/06/7-reasons-to-look-forward-to-bobbi-browns-new-youtube-channel.php |title=7 Reasons to Look Forward to Bobbi Brown's YouTube Channel – Beauty – Racked National |publisher=Racked.com |date=September 6, 2013 |accessdate=September 24, 2013}}</ref> The series lasted twenty-four episodes and ended March 7, 2014.
On November 4, 2013, Helbig premiered a weekly supplemental ''DailyGrace'' series exclusive to the My Damn Channel website entitled ''One Thing You Didn't Know About Me From Last Week''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mydamnchannel.com/daily_grace/one_thing_you_didn_t_know___/nudemexicanwrestling_11234 |title=One Thing You Didn't Know... " Nude Mexican Wrestling |publisher=My Damn Channel |date= |accessdate=March 1, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140208160807/http://www.mydamnchannel.com/daily_grace/one_thing_you_didn_t_know___/nudemexicanwrestling_11234 |archivedate=February 8, 2014 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> The series lasted five episodes and ended December 2, 2013.
On December 27, 2013, Helbig uploaded her final ''DailyGrace'' episode to the ''DailyGrace'' YouTube channel. Four days later, My Damn Channel released a statement announcing that Helbig had chosen not to renew her multi-year contract with the network, and that going forward, no new content would be created by Helbig for the ''DailyGrace'' YouTube channel. My Damn Channel indicated that the ''DailyGrace'' YouTube channel would remain active solely as an archive, with plans for the network to upload the early ''DailyGrace'' episodes and other Helbig content that had formerly been exclusive to the My Damn Channel website.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2013/12/31/my-damn-channel-daily-grace-helbig|title=Grace Helbig Is Leaving My Damn Channel And 'Daily Grace' In 2014|work=Tubefilter|accessdate=March 25, 2016}}</ref>
On January 6, 2014, Helbig relaunched her personally owned, formerly secondary channel ''it'sGrace'' (renamed from ''GracieHinABox'') as her main YouTube channel.<ref name="dailyDot">{{cite web |title=YouTuber Grace Helbig nabs E! talk show pilot |first=Rae |last=Votta |work=The Daily Dot |date=August 6, 2014 |accessdate=October 13, 2014 |url=http://www.dailydot.com/entertainment/grace-helbig-talk-show-pilot/}}</ref> News of Helbig's departure from My Damn Channel and the shift back to her own independent channel contributed to a dramatic increase in ''it'sGrace'' subscribers, from just under 87,000 in the last week of 2013 to over a half million by the first week of 2014. On January 22, 2014, just two and a half weeks after the channel's relaunch, ''it'sGrace'' passed 1 million subscribers.<ref>{{cite web|last=Cohen|first=Joshua|url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2014/01/22/grace-helbig-its-grace-subscribers/|title=Grace Helbig's New, Old YouTube Channel Reaches 1 Million Subscribers|publisher=''Tubefilter''|date=January 22, 2014|accessdate=March 1, 2014}}</ref> On April 30, 2014, it was announced via press release that Helbig had partnered with [[multi-channel network]] [[Fullscreen (company)|Fullscreen]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2014/04/30/its-grace-helbig-fullscreen/|title=Grace Helbig Partners With Fullscreen|publisher=''Tubefilter''|date=April 30, 2014|accessdate=April 30, 2014}}</ref> On December 30, 2014, just one week shy of the one-year anniversary of the channel's relaunch, ''it'sGrace'' passed 2 million subscribers. On August 22, 2016, ''it'sGrace'' passed 3 million subscribers, surpassing her ''DailyGrace'' channel peak. As of August 2018, the ''it'sGrace'' YouTube channel has over 2.9 million subscribers and over 310 million video views.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://vidstatsx.com/graciehinabox/youtube-channel |title=Grace Helbig YouTube Channel Stats |date= |accessdate=August 20, 2018}}</ref>
On July 1, 2014, Helbig and co-host [[Mamrie Hart]] premiered preview footage of their summer travel-themed web series ''#HeyUSA'' on the ''Astronauts Wanted'' YouTube channel.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mashable.com/2014/06/26/grace-helbig-mamrie-hart-youtube-heyusa/|title=YouTube Stars Take Summer Road Trip Guided by Fans|author=Josh Dickey|date=June 26, 2014|work=Mashable|accessdate=March 25, 2016}}</ref> Eight full-length episodes premiered on [[Conde Nast Entertainment]]'s digital video platform ''The Scene'' on October 15, 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thevideoink.com/news/heyusa-episodes-now-cnes-scene/#.VD65RWddV8F |title=All of Grace Helbig and Mamrie Hart's 'HeyUSA' Episodes Now Up on CNE's The Scene |publisher=Videoink.com |date=October 15, 2014 |accessdate=October 15, 2014}}</ref> A second season of ''#HeyUSA'' premiered on ''The Scene'' on April 16, 2015, albeit without Helbig as Hart's travel partner. Instead, Helbig introduced each episode and announced the location she chose for Hart and guest travel companions [[Kingsley (YouTube)|Kingsley]], [[Tyler Oakley]], [[Jenna Marbles]], [[Colleen Ballinger]], and [[Flula Borg]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/digital/news/youtube-star-mamrie-hart-hits-road-again-in-heyusa-travel-show-for-conde-nast-1201457092/ |title=YouTube Star Mamrie Hart Hits Road Again in 'HeyUSA' Travel Show for Condé Nast |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=March 20, 2015 |accessdate=March 25, 2015}}</ref>
On March 31, 2016, in conjunction with [[AT&T]] Hello Lab, Helbig premiered a new series ''Writing With Grace'' on her YouTube channel, in which she instructed viewers to collaborate with her via [[Wattpad]] to co-write a novella called "Freak Week". Helbig, along with other fellow YouTube personalities, held a live reading of the completed novella at [[VidCon]] on June 24, 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.broadwayworld.com/bwwtv/article/Video-Star-author-Grace-Helbig-Launches-Web-Series-CROWDSOURCE-AN-ORIGINAL-NOVELLA-20160401 |title=Video Star & author Grace Helbig Launches Web Series CROWDSOURCE AN ORIGINAL NOVELLA |publisher=Broadway World |date=April 1, 2016 |accessdate=April 1, 2016}}</ref>
On November 15, 2017, it was announced via press release that Helbig had left Fullscreen and partnered with [[multi-channel network]] Studio71.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2017/digital/news/grace-helbig-studio71-mamrie-hart-comedy-series-1202616176/ |title=Grace Helbig Leaves Fullscreen for Studio71, Developing New Show With Mamrie Hart |publisher=''Variety''|date=November 15, 2017|accessdate=November 20, 2017}}</ref>
Starting on March 5, 2018, Helbig and [[Mamrie Hart]] began hosting a new YouTube show together called ''This Might Get...''<ref name="thismightget">{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2018/digital/news/grace-helbig-mamrie-hart-youtube-daily-show-this-might-get-1202716549/ |title=Grace Helbig, Mamrie Hart on Their YouTube Talk Show: Pee-wee Herman Meets Hoda & Kathie Lee |last=Spangler |first=Todd |date=March 5, 2018 |website=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |publisher= |access-date=June 16, 2018 |quote=}}</ref> on a dedicated channel of the same name. Each episode has a different title, with the premiere being called "This Might Get Started," and focuses on a different topic, [[meme]], or pop culture event.<ref name="thismightget" /> It is executive produced by Michael Goldfine, who worked with the on-screen duo on ''Camp Takota'' and ''Dirty 30''.<ref name="thismightget" /> Hart and Helbig published their 100th episode of "This Might Get..." on July 20, 2018, entitled "Making Slime Fail!".
===Actress=== In 2009, Helbig appeared as the character of [[Barbie]] in the music video "Barbie Eat a Sandwich" by the band [[Care Bears on Fire]].<ref name=BarbieEatASandwich>{{cite web|title=Care Bears On Fire – Barbie Eat A Sandwich |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BGnVmU7FwFk |author=CareBearsOnFireVEVO|accessdate=April 5, 2017 }}</ref>
In 2012, during the inaugural IAWTV Awards, Helbig met with the [[Fine Brothers]]. The two still needed to cast someone to play the role of [[List of MyMusic characters#Idol|Idol]] for their new web series ''[[MyMusic]]'' and during their meeting, they offered her the role.<ref name="LAWeekly"/> Helbig flew out to [[Los Angeles]] the next week to shoot the first season.<ref>{{cite web|author=Shannon O'Connor |url=http://emertainmentmonthly.com/2013/06/22/grace-helbig-much-more-than-dailygrace/ |title=Grace Helbig: Much More Than DailyGrace |publisher=''Entertainment Monthly'' |date=June 22, 2013 |accessdate=August 31, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131004220136/http://emertainmentmonthly.com/2013/06/22/grace-helbig-much-more-than-dailygrace/ |archivedate=October 4, 2013 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Helbig subsequently appeared in the first seven episodes of the series' second season.
In July 2013, in the last three episodes of Season 2 Part 2 of the hit web series ''[[The Most Popular Girls in School]]'', Helbig voiced Jeannie Halverstad, the abrasive show host of Cheer Nationals. In March 2014, Helbig voiced a different character, Pamela Darabond, in three Season 3 episodes.
In May and June 2014, Helbig appeared as Anna in two episodes of the second season of the musical web series ''Side Effects'' on the AwesomenessTV YouTube channel.
On November 17, 2014 Helbig and [[Hannah Hart]] appeared as [[Juliet]] and [[Bonnie and Clyde#Bonnie Parker|Bonnie Parker]] respectively in the ''[[Epic Rap Battles of History]]'' Season 4 episode ''[[Romeo and Juliet]] vs. [[Bonnie and Clyde]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2014/11/17/hannah-hart-grace-helbig-epic-rap-battles-of-history/ |title=Hannah Hart, Grace Helbig Guest Star In 'Epic Rap Battles Of History' |publisher=tubefilter.com |date=November 17, 2014 |accessdate=November 17, 2014}}</ref>
On February 26, 2015, it was announced via various media outlets that Helbig would be co-starring with Hannah Hart in a [[reboot (fiction)|reboot]] of the 1970s [[Sid and Marty Krofft]] live action science fiction television series ''[[Electra Woman and Dyna Girl (2016 film)|Electra Woman and Dyna Girl]]''. The reboot, directed by [[Chris Marrs Piliero]], was shot in [[Vancouver]] during February and March 2015. The official trailer was released on March 29, 2016. The reboot was released on April 26, 2016 as an 8-episode web series on Fullscreen's subscription platform. It was released as a full-length feature film via various digital media outlets on June 7, 2016.<ref name="Mashable.com">{{cite web|url=http://mashable.com/2015/02/26/grace-helbig-mamrie-hart-electra-woman-and-dyna-girl/ |title=Grace Helbig, Hannah Hart are the new 'Electra Woman and Dyna Girl' |publisher=Mashable.com |date=February 26, 2015 |accessdate=February 27, 2015}}</ref><ref name="MTV.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2858141/electra-woman-dyna-girl-grace-helbig-hannah-hart-exclusive-trailer/ |title=An Exclusive First Look At Grace Helbig And Hannah Hart's Electra Woman & Dyna Girl |publisher=MTV.com |date=March 29, 2016 |accessdate=March 29, 2016}}</ref>
On August 6, 2015, Helbig was featured in a series of online commercials for [[Marriott Hotels & Resorts]] for the company's "It Pays to Book Direct" ad campaign.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/digital/news/grace-helbig-to-help-marriott-make-digital-pitch-1201557769/ |title=Grace Helbig to Help Marriott Make Digital Pitch' |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=August 6, 2015 |accessdate=August 6, 2015}}</ref>
On October 6, 2015, Helbig appeared in the fourth episode of PJ Liguori's web series ''[[Oscar's Hotel for Fantastical Creatures]]'' where she portrays the anthropomorphic hermit crab called Hermit. The six-episode series launched exclusively on [[Vimeo]]'s on-demand service.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/digital/news/jim-henson-co-creates-creatures-for-oscars-hotel-series-from-youtube-filmmaker-pj-liguori-1201544798/ |title=Jim Henson Co. Creates Creatures for 'Oscar's Hotel' Series from YouTube Filmmaker PJ Liguori |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=July 21, 2015 |accessdate=July 25, 2015}}</ref>
==Television==
Helbig has appeared in numerous commercials, as well as appeared as herself on various television shows and talk shows. She was first featured as Green Girl in a series of [[public service announcements]] for [[The N]]'s [[The Big Green Help]] environmental awareness campaign from 2008 to 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://vimeo.com/15144380 |title=The N's Green Girl Campaign |publisher=Vimeo |date=June 5, 2011 |accessdate=June 5, 2014}}</ref>
On January 5, 2015, it was announced via press release that Helbig would star in a hybrid comedy/talk show for E!, titled ''[[The Grace Helbig Show]]''. In preparation for the show, Helbig was interviewed live via [[Satellite television|satellite]] on multiple local television news broadcasts across the United States on March 27, 2015. ''The Grace Helbig Show'' premiered on April 3, 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/607365/grace-helbig-is-coming-to-e-with-new-show-premiering-in-april-get-all-the-details |title=Grace Helbig Is Coming to E! With New Show Premiering in April—Get All the Details! |date=January 5, 2015 |accessdate=January 5, 2015}}</ref> The series lasted eight episodes and ended June 7, 2015.

==Film== Helbig has appeared in several films as herself in collaborations with other YouTubers, including [[Film director|director]] Dan Dobi's 2012 YouTube documentary ''Please Subscribe''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pleasesubscribefilm.com/featuring/daily-grace/|title=Daily Grace « Please Subscribe Film|publisher=|accessdate=March 25, 2016}}</ref> and [[Corey Vidal]] and [[Shay Carl]]'s ''Vlogumentary''.
Her first film ''[[Camp Takota]]'' stars Helbig as a young woman who is forced to leave her big city job and head back to her old summer camp where she is reunited with old friends played by Hannah and Mamrie. The film, directed by Chris & Nick Riedell, began shooting in California on August 12, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://chill.com/camp |title=Camp Takota |publisher=Chill |date= |accessdate=September 10, 2013}}</ref> The film's official [[trailer (promotion)|trailer]] was released on December 24, 2013 on Helbig's, Hannah's and Mamrie's respective main YouTube channels, as well as on the film's official website.<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web|url=http://camptakota.com/ |title=Camp Takota |publisher=Camp Takota |date=February 14, 2014 |accessdate=March 1, 2014}}</ref> On February 5, 2014, an extended trailer was released on Helbig's ''it'sGrace'' channel and on the ''Camp Takota'' website.<ref name=autogenerated1 /><ref>{{YouTube|8gh9S9k3E9w|Camp Takota Official Extended Trailer – Youtube<!-- Bot generated title -->}}</ref> ''Camp Takota'' was released via digital download on February 14, 2014. The film was made available on [[streaming media]] service [[Netflix]] on December 1, 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2014/11/25/camp-takota-netflix-december-1st/ |title='Camp Takota' Is Coming To Netflix On December 1st |publisher=Tubefilter.com |date=November 25, 2014 |accessdate=December 1, 2014}}</ref>
Helbig appears in [[Alex Winter]]'s ''[[Smosh: The Movie]]'', starring [[Smosh|Anthony Padilla and Ian Hecox]], alongside fellow YouTubers Jenna Marbles, [[Markiplier]], [[Epic Meal Time|Harley Morenstein]] and others. The film's trailer (featuring Helbig) premiered on the ''Smosh'' YouTube channel on June 12, 2015. The film was released via various online outlets on July 24, 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2014/digital/news/lionsgate-acquires-worldwide-rights-to-the-smosh-movie-starring-youtube-comedy-duo-1201308432/|title=Lionsgate Acquires Worldwide Rights to the Smosh Movie Starring Youtube Comedy Duo|work=Variety|accessdate=October 9, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://thelaughbutton.com/news/smosh-the-movie-to-premiere-in-july-with-michael-ian-black-and-grace-helbig-featuring/|title=Smosh: The Movie to premiere in July with Michael Ian Black and Grace Helbig featuring|work=The Laugh Button|accessdate=April 16, 2015}}</ref>
Helbig co-starred with Hannah Hart in a reboot of the 1970s Sid and Marty Krofft live action science fiction television series ''Electra Woman and Dyna Girl''. The reboot, directed by Chris Marrs Piliero, was shot in Vancouver during February and March 2015. The official trailer was released on March 29, 2016. The reboot was released on April 26, 2016 as an 8-episode web series on Fullscreen's subscription platform. It was released as a full-length feature film via various digital media outlets on June 7, 2016.<ref name="Mashable.com"/><ref name="MTV.com"/>
Helbig and her ''Camp Takota'' co-stars Hannah Hart and Mamrie Hart appeared in a feature film titled ''Dirty 30''. The film, directed by Andrew Bush, began shooting in California on November 9, 2015. It was released digitally and in select theaters on September 23, 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/digital/news/lionsgate-buys-dirty-thirty-comedy-with-youtube-stars-grace-helbig-mamrie-hart-and-hannah-hart-1201629006/|title=Lionsgate Buys 'Dirty Thirty' Comedy With YouTube Stars Grace Helbig, Mamrie Hart and Hannah Hart|work=Variety|accessdate=October 30, 2015}}</ref>
On May 30, 2018, it was reported via various press outlets that Helbig had joined the cast of the upcoming film ''[[The Wedding Year]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/wanda-sykes-jenna-dewan-join-wedding-year-1115791|title=Wanda Sykes, Jenna Dewan Join Sarah Hyland in Rom-Com 'The Wedding Year'|work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=May 31, 2018}}</ref>

==Podcast== On September 1, 2014, Helbig premiered her audio-video podcast ''Not Too Deep with Grace Helbig''. New full-length audio episodes are made available each Monday on [[SoundCloud]] and [[iTunes]], with additional video footage featured on Helbig's ''it'sGrace'' YouTube channel.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/not-too-deep-with-grace/id909797285 |title=Not Too Deep with Grace Helbig |date=August 18, 2014 |accessdate=August 19, 2014}}</ref> Podcast episodes are produced by Jack Ferry.
The podcast debuted at number one on iTunes' Top Podcasts chart.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2014/09/01/grace-helbig-podcast-not-too-deep-itunes/ |title=Grace Helbig's Audio-Video Podcast 'Not Too Deep' Debuts At #1 On iTunes |date=September 1, 2014 |accessdate=September 1, 2014}}</ref>
Most "season one" episodes were recorded at the YouTube Space Los Angeles (unless otherwise noted), most "season two" episodes were recorded at Helbig's Los Angeles home (unless otherwise noted), most "season three" episodes are recorded at Helbig's Los Angeles office space (unless otherwise noted), and most "season four" episodes are recorded at Fullscreen's studios (unless otherwise noted).
Most "season one" challenges are variations of pre-existing YouTube challenges, whereas most "season two" challenges pre-exist on YouTube. Beginning "season three" and continuing with "season four", challenges have been phased out in favor of video highlights of the interviews.
Beginning September 12, 2016, ''Not Too Deep with Grace Helbig'' began broadcasting for the first time in full-length video format on Fullscreen's subscription service, with episodes being filmed at Fullscreen's studios. Audio-only of the prior week's video episode available on iTunes and Soundcloud the following week.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2016/08/31/fullscreen-visual-version-grace-helbig-not-too-deep-podcast/ |title=Fullscreen Orders 35-Episode Visual Version Of Grace Helbig's 'Not Too Deep' Podcast |date=August 31, 2016 |accessdate=September 1, 2016}}</ref>
On November 13, 2017, it was announced across various media outlets that Fullscreen would be shutting down its subscription service. The final full-length video episode of ''Not Too Deep with Grace Helbig'' was released the same day as the announcement. The podcast continues to air new audio-only episodes every Monday via iTunes and Soundcloud.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2017/11/fullscreen-svod-service-ending-2018-1202207399// |title=Fullscreen Media To Shutter Its SVOD Service |date=November 13, 2017 |accessdate=November 20, 2017}}</ref>

==Live performances== [[File:Mamrie Hart and Grace Helbig at No Filter in December 2013.jpg|thumb|[[Mamrie Hart]] and Helbig onstage at ''No Filter'' in December 2013]]
In addition to her web and television content, Helbig has performed live on stage in various formats throughout the United States, Canada, England, Ireland and Australia, including the following:
In 2011, Helbig co-hosted the monthly live late night stage show ''Morning Show'' with Jacob "Hobart" Brown.<ref name="morningshowTumblr" /><ref name="morningShowGLOC" />
On January 15, 2013, Helbig participated on stage as part of "An Evening of Awesome" with [[VlogBrothers|John and Hank Green]], [[Neil Gaiman]], Hannah Hart, Ashley Clements and Daniel Vincent Gordh.<ref>{{cite web|author=Breia Brissey|url=http://shelf-life.ew.com/2013/01/16/an-evening-of-awesome-john-green-hank-green-carnegie-hall/|title= On the scene: 'An Evening of Awesome' with John Green at Carnegie Hall|publisher=Entertainment Weekly|date=January 16, 2013|accessdate=October 13, 2013}}</ref>
During May, June and December 2013, August, October and November 2014, and May and June 2015, Helbig (along with Hannah Hart and Mamrie Hart) embarked on a live comedy show across America titled [[Hannah Hart#No Filter|#NoFilterShow]].<ref name="LAWeekly"/><ref name="dailyDot"/> Their show ventured overseas to [[London]] and [[Dublin]] in May 2014 and to [[Australia]] in December 2015. They encouraged people to film and document the show and incorporated the use of social media by using internet comments and Twitter mentions in crowd games.<ref>{{cite web|author=Nick A. Zaino III |url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/arts/2013/05/23/with-daily-grace-videos-comedian-grace-helbig-builds-fan-base-online/ntPCVNQ4X4WG0SrkjFNCvK/story.html |title=With 'Daily Grace' videos, comedian Grace Helbig builds a fan base online – Theater & art |publisher=The Boston Globe |date=May 23, 2013 |accessdate=June 24, 2013}}</ref>
On March 15, 2014, Helbig and Mamrie Hart performed a one-off live comedy show, ''This Might Get Weird, Y'all'' in [[Boston]]. In November and December 2014, Helbig and Hart took the show on the road, performing in five US cities in support of Helbig's newly published book ''Grace's Guide''.<ref>{{cite web|author=Evie Carpenter |url=http://www.phoenixnewtimes.com/arts/youtube-comedians-mamrie-hart-and-grace-helbig-on-selfies-drake-trivia-and-figuring-out-arizona-6551969 |title=YouTube Comedians Mamrie Hart and Grace Helbig On Selfies, Drake Trivia, and Figuring Out Arizona |publisher=Phoenix New Times |date=December 5, 2014 |accessdate=June 15, 2015}}</ref> Helbig and Hart performed their show at Stream Con NYC on October 30, 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://streamconnyc.com/grace-helbig-and-mamrie-hart/ |title=Grace Helbig and Mamrie Hart |publisher=StreamConNYC.com |accessdate=October 26, 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151021071908/http://streamconnyc.com/grace-helbig-and-mamrie-hart/ |archivedate=October 21, 2015 |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Helbig and Hart took their show overseas to London and Dublin in late November 2016.
On July 25, 2014, Helbig performed along with comedians [[Steve Agee]] and [[Brian Posehn]] at San Diego's [[Comic convention|Comic Con]] as a part of [[Comedy Central]] presents "@midnight."<ref>{{Cite web|title = ZAP! POW! BANG! COMEDY CENTRAL® HITS SAN DIEGO...|url = http://press.cc.com/press-release/2014/07/21/press-comedy-central-at-comic-con-2014|website = Comedy Central Press|accessdate = September 25, 2015}}</ref>
On September 7, 2014, Helbig and Hannah Hart hosted the 4th Annual [[Streamy Awards]].<ref>http://www.streamys.org/2014/08/comedians-grace-helbig-and-hannah-hart-host-4th-annual-streamy-awards-presented-coca-cola/ Comedians Grace Helbig and Hannah Hart to Host the Streamys</ref>
On September 17, 2015, Helbig hosted the Streamy Awards for the second year in a row, this time with Tyler Oakley as her co-host. The Streamys aired for the first time on television, on [[VH1]].<ref>http://www.streamys.org/2015/08/grace-helbig-and-tyler-oakley-to-host-the-5th-annual-streamy-awards/ Grace Helbig and Tyler Oakley to Host the 5th Annual Streamy Awards</ref>
On September 26, 2015, Helbig recorded an episode of her Not Too Deep podcast (with guest Harley Morenstein) in front of a live audience in Toronto as part of the JFL42 comedy festival.<ref>https://www.jfl42.com/act/not-too-deep-live-with-grace-helbig/ Not Too Deep Live with Grace Helbig</ref>
On October 22, 2015, Helbig told a story in front of a live audience at the [[NerdMelt Showroom]] for the ''[[Risk!]]'' podcast.<ref>http://holdmyticket.com/event/223957/ RISK! LA w/ R. Ben Garant & Grace Helbig</ref>
On February 4, 2016, Helbig read excerpts from her book ''Grace & Style: The Art of Pretending You Have It'' and was interviewed in front of a live audience as part of [[New Hampshire Public Radio|New Hampshire Public Radio's]] series ''[[New Hampshire Public Radio#Writers on a New England Stage|Writers on a New England Stage]]'' at [[The Music Hall (Portsmouth)|The Music Hall]] in [[Portsmouth, New Hampshire]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.seacoastonline.com/article/20151217/NEWS/151219196 |title=Grace Helbig to bring comedy and 'style' to The Music Hall |publisher=Seacoastonline.com |date=December 17, 2015 |accessdate=April 6, 2016}}</ref>
==Awards and nominations== Helbig has received various accolades in recognition of her web videos and comedic content, including the following:
''DailyGrace'' was elected ''King of the Web'' in October 2011.<ref name="KingOfWebOctober2011"/>
Helbig's personal Twitter was listed in the Humor section of [[Time Magazine]]'s ''140 Best Twitter Feeds of 2012''.<ref name="Time140BestTwitter2012"/>
Helbig was listed among [[BuzzFeed]]'s ''11 Awesome Up-And-Coming Funny Ladies You Should Know''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/fox/11-awesome-up-and-coming-funny-ladies-you-should-k-7juf|title=11 Awesome Up-And-Coming Funny Ladies You Should Know|author=FOX|work=BuzzFeed|accessdate=October 9, 2014}}</ref>
She was named one of the ''30 Under 30 Rising Stars in Los Angeles'' by [[Refinery29]] in July 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.refinery29.com/30-under-30-los-angeles|title=30 Under 30 – Rising Stars in Los Angeles|date=July 24, 2013|work=Refinery29|accessdate=October 9, 2014}}</ref>
Helbig was listed in the entertainment section of [[Forbes]]' ''30 under 30 Who Are Changing The World 2014''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/special-report/2014/30-under-30/hollywood-and-entertainment.html#grace_helbig|title=30 Under 30 – Hollywood & Entertainment – Forbes|work=Forbes|accessdate=March 25, 2016}}</ref>
Helbig was named one of the ''100 Most Creative People In Business 2014'' according to [[Fast Company (magazine)|Fast Company]] magazine.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fastcompany.com/3029539/most-creative-people-2014/grace-helbig|title=Grace Helbig|work=Fast Company|accessdate=October 9, 2014}}</ref>
She was listed among [[The Hollywood Reporter]]'s ''Silicon Beach Power 25: A Ranking of L.A.'s Top Digital Media Players'' in May 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/person/grace-helbig|title=Grace Helbig|date=May 28, 2014|work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=October 9, 2014}}</ref>
Helbig was named one of [[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'s ''10 Comics to Watch'' in June 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2014/tv/news/variety-picks-10-comics-to-watch-for-2014-1201225728|title=Variety Picks 10 Comics to Watch for 2014|work=Variety|accessdate=October 9, 2014}}</ref>
She was listed among Social Media Week Los Angeles' ''Social 25'' digital media influencers and organizations in September 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2014/09/16/social-media-week-los-angeles-whats-trending-smwla-social-25/|title=Fine Bros, Grace Helbig Among This Year's Social 25 Honorees At SMWLA|work=Fine Bros, Grace Helbig Among This Year's Social 25 Honorees At SMWLA|accessdate=October 9, 2014}}</ref>
In 2014, Helbig's YouTube Channel was listed on [[New Media Rockstars]] Top 100 Channels, ranked at #36.<ref>{{cite web|title=The NMR Top 100 YouTube Channels: 50-26!|url= http://newmediarockstars.com/2014/12/the-nmr-top-100-youtube-channels-50-26/|website=New Media Rockstars|accessdate=January 6, 2015}}</ref>
In March 2015, she was named one of Time Magazine's ''30 Most Influential People on the Internet''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://time.com/3732203/the-30-most-influential-people-on-the-internet/|title=The 30 Most Influential People on the Internet|work=Time Magazine|accessdate=March 5, 2015}}</ref>
In April 2015, she was named one of [[New York (magazine)#Digital expansion and blogs|Vulture]]'s ''50 Comedians You Should Know in 2015''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vulture.com/2015/03/50-comedians-you-should-know-in-2015.html/ |title=The 50 Comedians You Should Know in 2015 |work=Vulture |accessdate=March 30, 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150331005845/http://www.vulture.com/2015/03/50-comedians-you-should-know-in-2015.html |archivedate=March 31, 2015 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
In July 2015, she was named one of The Hollywood Reporter's ''Top 25 Digital Stars''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/person/grace-helbig-0|title=Grace Helbig: Chelsea Handler 2.0|date=July 16, 2015|work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=July 16, 2015}}</ref>
In July 2015, she was listed among [[Adweek]]'s ''Creative 100'' in the ''10 Viral Content Creators'' category.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.adweek.com/news-gallery/technology/10-viral-content-creators-who-electrify-fans-millions-165991|title=10 Viral Content Creators Who Electrify Fans by the Millions Playing by their own rules, and winning big|date=July 19, 2015|work=Adweek|accessdate=July 20, 2015}}</ref>
In October 2016, she was listed among Variety's ''Hollywood's New Leaders'' in the ''Creators'' category.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2016/film/spotlight/varietys-new-leaders-2016-the-creatives-1201893079/|title=Hollywood’s New Leaders 2016: The Creatives|date=October 19, 2016|work=Adweek|accessdate=October 24, 2016}}</ref>

==Books== In October 2014, Helbig's self-penned comedic [[self-help]] [[handbook]] for [[Millennials]], ''Grace's Guide: The Art of Pretending to Be a Grown-up'', was published by Touchstone, an imprint of [[Simon & Schuster]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Graces-Guide-The-Pretending-Grown-up-ebook/dp/B00KE4IT9G |title=Grace's Guide: The Art of Pretending to Be a Grown-up |date=May 17, 2014 |accessdate=May 17, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://gracesguidebook.com/ |title=Grace's Guide by Grace Helbig |date=May 20, 2014 |accessdate=May 20, 2014}}</ref> The book debuted at number one on [[The New York Times Best Seller list|the New York Times Best Seller Advice, How-To and Miscellaneous list]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=YouTube Star Grace Helbig Hits #1 On New York Times Best Sellers List |first=Joshua |last=Cohen |work=Tubefilter |date=October 29, 2014 |accessdate=October 30, 2014 |url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2014/10/29/grace-helbig-graces-guide-book-1-new-york-times-best-sellers-list/}}</ref>
On February 2, 2016, Helbig's second book, ''Grace & Style: The Art of Pretending You Have It'', was published by Touchstone.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/dp/1501120581 |title=Grace & Style: The Art of Pretending You Have It |accessdate=December 6, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://gracestylebook.com/ |title=Grace & Style by Grace Helbig |accessdate=December 6, 2015}}</ref> The book debuted at number seven on the ''New York Times'' Best Seller Advice, How-To and Miscellaneous list.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Grace Helbig Is Now The Author Of Two New York Times Best-Selling Books |first=Geoff |last=Weiss |work=Tubefilter |date=February 11, 2016 |accessdate=February 16, 2016 |url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2016/02/11/grace-helbig-is-now-the-author-of-two-new-york-times-best-selling-books/}}</ref>
